register.name: IC_CON
register.description: Name: I2C Control Register Size: 7 bits Address Offset: 0x00 Read/Write Access: If configuration parameter I2C_DYNAMIC_TAR_UPDATE = 0, all bits are Read/Write. If I2C_DYNAMIC_TAR_UPDATE = 1, bit 4 is Read-only. This register can be written only when the DW_apb_i2c is disabled, which corresponds to the IC_ENABLE register being set to 0. Writes at other times have no effect.

field.name: MASTER_MODE
field.description: This bit controls whether the DW_apb_i2c master is enabled

field.name: SPEED
field.description: These bits control at which speed the DW_apb_i2c operates; its setting is relevant only if one is operating the DW_apb_i2c in master mode

field.name: IC_10BITADDR_SLAVE
field.description: When acting as a slave, this bit controls whether the DW_apb_i2c responds to 7- or 10-bit addresses

enumeratedValue.name: V_0
enumeratedValue.description: 7-bit addressing. The DW_apb_i2c ignores transactions that involve 10-bit addressing; for 7-bit addressing, only the lower 7 bits of the IC_SAR register are compared.

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: 10-bit addressing. The DW_apb_i2c responds to only 10-bit addressing transfers that match the full 10 bits of the IC_SAR register.

field.name: IC_10BITADDR_MASTER_rd_only
field.description: If the I2C_DYNAMIC_TAR_UPDATE configuration parameter is set to 'No' (0), this bit is named IC_10BITADDR_MASTER and controls whether the DW_apb_i2c starts its transfers in 7- or 10-bit addressing mode when acting as a master

field.name: IC_RESTART_EN
field.description: Determines whether RESTART conditions may be sent when acting as a master

field.name: IC_SLAVE_DISABLE
field.description: This bit controls whether I2C has its slave disabled, which means once the presetn signal is applied, then this bit takes on the value of the configuration parameter IC_SLAVE_DISABLE

register.name: IC_TAR
register.description: Name: I2C Target Address Register Size: 12 bits or 13 bits; 13 bits only when I2C_DYNAMIC_TAR_UPDATE = 1 Address Offset: 0x04 Read/Write Access: Read/Write If the configuration parameter I2C_DYNAMIC_TAR_UPDATE is set to 'No' (0), this register is 12 bits wide, and bits 15:12 are reserved. This register can be written to only when IC_ENABLE is set to 0. However, if I2C_DYNAMIC_TAR_UPDATE = 1, then the register becomes 13 bits wide. All bits can be dynamically updated as long as any set of the following conditions are true: - DW_apb_i2c is NOT enabled (IC_ENABLE is set to 0); or - DW_apb_i2c is enabled (IC_ENABLE=1); AND DW_apb_i2c is NOT engaged in any Master (tx, rx) operation (IC_STATUS[5]=0); AND DW_apb_i2c is enabled to operate in Master mode (IC_CON[0]=1); AND there are NO entries in the TX FIFO (IC_STATUS[2]=1)

field.name: IC_TAR
field.description: This is the target address for any master transaction

field.name: GC_OR_START
field.description: If bit 11 (SPECIAL) is set to 1, then this bit indicates whether a General Call or START byte command is to be performed by the DW_apb_i2c

enumeratedValue.name: V_0
enumeratedValue.description: General Call Address after issuing a General Call, only writes may be performed. Attempting to issue a read command results in setting bit 6 (TX_ABRT) of the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register. The DW_apb_i2c remains in General Call mode until the SPECIAL bit value (bit 11) is cleared.

field.name: SPECIAL
field.description: This bit indicates whether software performs a General Call or START BYTE command

enumeratedValue.name: V_0
enumeratedValue.description: ignore bit 10 GC_OR_START and use IC_TAR normally

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: perform special I2C command as specified in GC_OR_START bit

field.name: IC_10BITADDR_MASTER
field.description: This bit controls whether the DW_apb_i2c starts its transfers in 7- or 10-bit addressing mode when acting as a master

register.name: IC_SAR
register.description: Name: I2C Slave Address Register Size: 10 bits Address Offset: 0x08 Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: IC_SAR
field.description: The IC_SAR holds the slave address when the I2C is operating as a slave

register.name: IC_HS_MADDR
register.description: Name: I2C High Speed Master Mode Code Address Register Size: 3 bits Address Offset: 0x0c Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: IC_HS_MAR
field.description: This bit field holds the value of the I2C HS mode master code

register.name: IC_DATA_CMD
register.description: Name: I2C Rx/Tx Data Buffer and Command Register; this is the register the CPU writes to when filling the TX FIFO and the CPU reads from when retrieving bytes from RX FIFO Size: 9 bits (writes) 8 bits (reads) Address Offset: 0x10 Read/Write Access: Read/Write NOTE: With nine bits required for writes, the DW_apb_i2c requires 16-bit data on the APB bus transfers when writing into the transmit FIFO. Eight-bit transfers remain for reads from the receive FIFO.

field.name: DAT
field.description: This register contains the data to be transmitted or received on the I2C bus

field.name: CMD
field.description: This bit controls whether a read or a write is performed

register.name: IC_SS_SCL_HCNT
register.description: Name: Standard Speed I2C Clock SCL High Count Register Size: 16 bits Address Offset: 0x14 Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: IC_SS_SCL_HCNT
field.description: This register must be set before any I2C bus transaction can take place to ensure proper I/O timing

register.name: IC_SS_SCL_LCNT
register.description: Name: Standard Speed I2C Clock SCL Low Count Register Size: 16 bits Address Offset: 0x18 Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: IC_SS_SCL_LCNT
field.description: This register must be set before any I2C bus transaction can take place to ensure proper I/O timing

register.name: IC_FS_SCL_HCNT
register.description: Name: Fast Speed I2C Clock SCL High Count Register Size: 16 bits Address Offset: 0x1c Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: IC_FS_SCL_HCNT
field.description: This register must be set before any I2C bus transaction can take place to ensure proper I/O timing

register.name: IC_FS_SCL_LCNT
register.description: Name: Fast Speed I2C Clock SCL Low Count Register Size: 16 bits Address Offset: 0x20 Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: IC_FS_SCL_LCNT
field.description: This register must be set before any I2C bus transaction can take place to ensure proper I/O timing

register.name: IC_HS_SCL_HCNT
register.description: Name: High Speed I2C Clock SCL High Count Register Size: 16 bits Address Offset: 0x24 Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: IC_HS_SCL_HCNT
field.description: This register must be set before any I2C bus transaction can take place to ensure proper I/O timing

register.name: IC_HS_SCL_LCNT
register.description: Name: High Speed I2C Clock SCL Low Count Register Size: 16 bits Address Offset: 0x28 Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: IC_HS_SCL_LCNT
field.description: This register must be set before any I2C bus transaction can take place to ensure proper I/O timing

register.name: IC_INTR_STAT
register.description: Name: I2C Interrupt Status Register Size: 12 bits Address Offset: 0x2C Read/Write Access: Read Each bit in this register has a corresponding mask bit in the IC_INTR_MASK register. These bits are cleared by reading the matching interrupt clear register. The unmasked raw versions of these bits are available in the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register.

field.name: R_RX_UNDER
field.description: Set if the processor attempts to read the receive buffer when it is empty by reading from the IC_DATA_CMD register

field.name: R_RX_OVER
field.description: Set if the receive buffer is completely filled to IC_RX_BUFFER_DEPTH and an additional byte is received from an external I2C device

field.name: R_RX_FULL
field.description: Set when the receive buffer reaches or goes above the RX_TL threshold in the IC_RX_TL register

field.name: R_TX_OVER
field.description: Set during transmit if the transmit buffer is filled to IC_TX_BUFFER_DEPTH and the processor attempts to issue another I2C command by writing to the IC_DATA_CMD register

field.name: R_TX_EMPTY
field.description: This bit is set to 1 when the transmit buffer is at or below the threshold value set in the IC_TX_TL register

field.name: R_RD_REQ
field.description: This bit is set to 1 when DW_apb_i2c is acting as a slave and another I2C master is attempting to read data from DW_apb_i2c

field.name: R_TX_ABRT
field.description: This bit indicates if DW_apb_i2c, as an I2C transmitter, is unable to complete the intended actions on the contents of the transmit FIFO

field.name: R_RX_DONE
field.description: When the DW_apb_i2c is acting as a slave-transmitter, this bit is set to 1 if the master does not acknowledge a transmitted byte

field.name: R_ACTIVITY
field.description: This bit captures DW_apb_i2c activity and stays set until it is cleared

field.name: R_STOP_DET
field.description: Indicates whether a STOP condition has occurred on the I2C interface regardless of whether DW_apb_i2c is operating in slave or master mode

field.name: R_START_DET
field.description: Indicates whether a START or RESTART condition has occurred on the I2C interface regardless of whether DW_apb_i2c is operating in slave or master mode

field.name: R_GEN_CALL
field.description: Set only when a General Call address is received and it is acknowledged

register.name: IC_INTR_MASK
register.description: Name: I2C Interrupt Mask Register Size: 12 bits Address Offset: 0x30 Read/Write Access: Read/Write These bits mask their corresponding interrupt status bits. They are active high; a value of 0 prevents a bit from generating an interrupt.

field.name: M_RX_UNDER
field.description: Set if the processor attempts to read the receive buffer when it is empty by reading from the IC_DATA_CMD register

field.name: M_RX_OVER
field.description: Set if the receive buffer is completely filled to IC_RX_BUFFER_DEPTH and an additional byte is received from an external I2C device

field.name: M_RX_FULL
field.description: Set when the receive buffer reaches or goes above the RX_TL threshold in the IC_RX_TL register

field.name: M_TX_OVER
field.description: Set during transmit if the transmit buffer is filled to IC_TX_BUFFER_DEPTH and the processor attempts to issue another I2C command by writing to the IC_DATA_CMD register

field.name: M_TX_EMPTY
field.description: This bit is set to 1 when the transmit buffer is at or below the threshold value set in the IC_TX_TL register

field.name: M_RD_REQ
field.description: This bit is set to 1 when DW_apb_i2c is acting as a slave and another I2C master is attempting to read data from DW_apb_i2c

field.name: M_TX_ABRT
field.description: This bit indicates if DW_apb_i2c, as an I2C transmitter, is unable to complete the intended actions on the contents of the transmit FIFO

field.name: M_RX_DONE
field.description: When the DW_apb_i2c is acting as a slave-transmitter, this bit is set to 1 if the master does not acknowledge a transmitted byte

field.name: M_ACTIVITY
field.description: This bit captures DW_apb_i2c activity and stays set until it is cleared

field.name: M_STOP_DET
field.description: Indicates whether a STOP condition has occurred on the I2C interface regardless of whether DW_apb_i2c is operating in slave or master mode

field.name: M_START_DET
field.description: Indicates whether a START or RESTART condition has occurred on the I2C interface regardless of whether DW_apb_i2c is operating in slave or master mode

field.name: M_GEN_CALL
field.description: Set only when a General Call address is received and it is acknowledged

register.name: IC_RAW_INTR_STAT
register.description: Name: I2C Raw Interrupt Status Register Size: 12 bits Address Offset: 0x34 Read/Write Access: Read Unlike the IC_INTR_STAT register, these bits are not masked so they always show the true status of the DW_apb_i2c.

field.name: RX_UNDER
field.description: Set if the processor attempts to read the receive buffer when it is empty by reading from the IC_DATA_CMD register

field.name: RX_OVER
field.description: Set if the receive buffer is completely filled to IC_RX_BUFFER_DEPTH and an additional byte is received from an external I2C device

field.name: RX_FULL
field.description: Set when the receive buffer reaches or goes above the RX_TL threshold in the IC_RX_TL register

field.name: TX_OVER
field.description: Set during transmit if the transmit buffer is filled to IC_TX_BUFFER_DEPTH and the processor attempts to issue another I2C command by writing to the IC_DATA_CMD register

field.name: TX_EMPTY
field.description: This bit is set to 1 when the transmit buffer is at or below the threshold value set in the IC_TX_TL register

field.name: RD_REQ
field.description: This bit is set to 1 when DW_apb_i2c is acting as a slave and another I2C master is attempting to read data from DW_apb_i2c

field.name: TX_ABRT
field.description: This bit indicates if DW_apb_i2c, as an I2C transmitter, is unable to complete the intended actions on the contents of the transmit FIFO

field.name: RX_DONE
field.description: When the DW_apb_i2c is acting as a slave-transmitter, this bit is set to 1 if the master does not acknowledge a transmitted byte

field.name: ACTIVITY
field.description: This bit captures DW_apb_i2c activity and stays set until it is cleared

field.name: STOP_DET
field.description: Indicates whether a STOP condition has occurred on the I2C interface regardless of whether DW_apb_i2c is operating in slave or master mode

field.name: START_DET
field.description: Indicates whether a START or RESTART condition has occurred on the I2C interface regardless of whether DW_apb_i2c is operating in slave or master mode

field.name: GEN_CALL
field.description: Set only when a General Call address is received and it is acknowledged

register.name: IC_RX_TL
register.description: Name: I2C Receive FIFO Threshold Register Size: 8bits Address Offset: 0x38 Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: RX_TL
field.description: Receive FIFO Threshold Level Controls the level of entries (or above) that triggers the RX_FULL interrupt (bit 2 in IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register)

register.name: IC_TX_TL
register.description: Name: I2C Transmit FIFO Threshold Register Size: 8 bits Address Offset: 0x3c Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: TX_TL
field.description: Transmit FIFO Threshold Level Controls the level of entries (or below) that trigger the TX_EMPTY interrupt (bit 4 in IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register)

register.name: IC_CLR_INTR
register.description: Name: Clear Combined and Individual Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x40 Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_INTR
field.description: Read this register to clear the combined interrupt, all individual interrupts, and the IC_TX_ABRT_SOURCE register

register.name: IC_CLR_RX_UNDER
register.description: Name: Clear RX_UNDER Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x44 Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_RX_UNDER
field.description: Read this register to clear the RX_UNDER interrupt (bit 0) of the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register

register.name: IC_CLR_RX_OVER
register.description: Name: Clear RX_OVER Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x48 Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_RX_OVER
field.description: Read this register to clear the RX_OVER interrupt (bit 1) of the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register

register.name: IC_CLR_TX_OVER
register.description: Name: Clear TX_OVER Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x4c Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_TX_OVER
field.description: Read this register to clear the TX_OVER interrupt (bit 3) of the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register

register.name: IC_CLR_RD_REQ
register.description: Name: Clear RD_REQ Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x50 Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_RD_REQ
field.description: Read this register to clear the RD_REQ interrupt (bit 5) of the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register

register.name: IC_CLR_TX_ABRT
register.description: Name: Clear TX_ABRT Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x54 Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_TX_ABRT
field.description: Read this register to clear the TX_ABRT interrupt (bit 6) of the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register, and the IC_TX_ABRT_SOURCE register

register.name: IC_CLR_RX_DONE
register.description: Name: Clear RX_DONE Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x58 Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_RX_DONE
field.description: Read this register to clear the RX_DONE interrupt (bit 7) of the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register

register.name: IC_CLR_ACTIVITY
register.description: Name: Clear ACTIVITY Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x5c Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_ACTIVITY
field.description: Reading this register clears the ACTIVITY interrupt if the I2C is not active anymore

register.name: IC_CLR_STOP_DET
register.description: Name: Clear STOP_DET Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x60 Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_STOP_DET
field.description: Read this register to clear the STOP_DET interrupt (bit 9) of the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register

register.name: IC_CLR_START_DET
register.description: Name: Clear START_DET Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x64 Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_START_DET
field.description: Read this register to clear the START_DET interrupt (bit 10) of the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register

register.name: IC_CLR_GEN_CALL
register.description: Name: Clear GEN_CALL Interrupt Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x68 Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: CLR_GEN_CALL
field.description: Read this register to clear the GEN_CALL interrupt (bit 11) of IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register

register.name: IC_ENABLE
register.description: Name: I2C Enable Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x6c Read/Write Access: Read/Write

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Controls whether the DW_apb_i2c is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: V_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disables DW_apb_i2c (TX and RX FIFOs are held in an erased state)

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enables DW_apb_i2c Software can disable DW_apb_i2c while it is active. However, it is important that care be taken to ensure that DW_apb_i2c is disabled properly. When DW_apb_i2c is disabled, the following occurs:

register.name: IC_STATUS
register.description: Name: I2C Status Register Size: 7 bits Address Offset: 0x70 Read/Write Access: Read This is a read-only register used to indicate the current transfer status and FIFO status. The status register may be read at any time. None of the bits in this register request an interrupt. When the I2C is disabled by writing 0 in bit 0 of the IC_ENABLE register: - Bits 1 and 2 are set to 1 - Bits 3 and 4 are set to 0 When the master or slave state machines goes to idle and ic_en=0: - Bits 5 and 6 are set to 0

enumeratedValue.name: V_0
enumeratedValue.description: Master FSM is in IDLE state so the Master part of DW_apb_i2c is not Active

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Master FSM is not in IDLE state so the Master part of DW_apb_i2c is Active Note IC_STATUS[0]-that is, ACTIVITY bit-is the OR of SLV_ACTIVITY and MST_ACTIVITY bits.

enumeratedValue.name: V_0
enumeratedValue.description: Slave FSM is in IDLE state so the Slave part of DW_apb_i2c is not Active

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Slave FSM is not in IDLE state so the Slave part of DW_apb_i2c is Active

register.name: IC_TXFLR
register.description: Name: I2C Transmit FIFO Level Register Size: TX_ABW + 1 Address Offset: 0x74 Read/Write Access: Read This register contains the number of valid data entries in the transmit FIFO buffer. It is cleared whenever: - The I2C is disabled - There is a transmit abortthat is, TX_ABRT bit is set in the IC_RAW_INTR_STAT register - The slave bulk transmit mode is aborted The register increments whenever data is placed into the transmit FIFO and decrements when data is taken from the transmit FIFO.

register.name: IC_RXFLR
register.description: Name: I2C Receive FIFO Level Register Size: RX_ABW + 1 Address Offset: 0x78 Read/Write Access: Read This register contains the number of valid data entries in the receive FIFO buffer. It is cleared whenever: - The I2C is disabled - Whenever there is a transmit abort caused by any of the events tracked in IC_TX_ABRT_SOURCE The register increments whenever data is placed into the receive FIFO and decrements when data is taken from the receive FIFO.

field.name: RXFLR
field.description: Receive FIFO Level. Contains the number of valid data entries in the receive FIFO. Reset value: 0x0

register.name: IC_SDA_HOLD
register.description: Name: I2C SDA Hold Register Size: 16 bits Address Offset: 0x7c Read/Write Access: Read/Write This register controls the amount of time delay (in terms of number of ic_clk clock periods) introduced in the falling edge of SCL, relative to SDA changing, when DW_apb_i2c services a read request in a slave-transmitter operation. The relevant I2C requirement is thd:DAT as detailed in the I2C Bus Specification.

register.name: IC_TX_ABRT_SOURCE
register.description: Name: I2C Transmit Abort Source Register Size: 16 bits Address Offset: 0x80 Read/Write Access: Read/Write This register has 16 bits that indicate the source of the TX_ABRT bit. Except for Bit 9, this register is cleared whenever the IC_CLR_TX_ABRT register or the IC_CLR_INTR register is read. To clear Bit 9, the source of the ABRT_SBYTE_NORSTRT must be fixed first; RESTART must be enabled (IC_CON[5]=1), the SPECIAL bit must be cleared (IC_TAR[11]), or the GC_OR_START bit must be cleared (IC_TAR[10]). Once the source of the ABRT_SBYTE_NORSTRT is fixed, then this bit can be cleared in the same manner as other bits in this register. If the source of the ABRT_SBYTE_NORSTRT is not fixed before attempting to clear this bit, Bit 9 clears for one cycle and is then re-asserted.

field.name: ABRT_7B_ADDR_NOACK
field.description: 1: Master is in 7-bit addressing mode and the address sent was not acknowledged by any slave

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Master is in 7-bit addressing mode and the address sent was not acknowledged by any slave.

field.name: ABRT_10ADDR1_NOACK
field.description: 1: Master is in 10-bit address mode and the first 10-bit address byte was not acknowledged by any slave

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Master is in 10-bit address mode and the first 10-bit address byte was not acknowledged by any slave.

field.name: ABRT_10ADDR2_NOACK
field.description: 1: Master is in 10-bit address mode and the second address byte of the 10-bit address was not acknowledged by any slave

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Master is in 10-bit address mode and the second address byte of the 10-bit address was not acknowledged by any slave.

field.name: ABRT_TXDATA_NOACK
field.description: 1: This is a master-mode only bit

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: This is a master-mode only bit. Master has received an acknowledgement for the address, but when it sent data byte(s) following the address, it did not receive an acknowledge from the remote slave(s).

field.name: ABRT_GCALL_NOACK
field.description: 1: DW_apb_i2c in master mode sent a General Call and no slave on the bus acknowledged the General Call

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: DW_apb_i2c in master mode sent a General Call and no slave on the bus acknowledged the General Call.

field.name: ABRT_GCALL_READ
field.description: 1: DW_apb_i2c in master mode sent a General Call but the user programmed the byte following the General Call to be a read from the bus (IC_DATA_CMD[9] is set to 1)

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: DW_apb_i2c in master mode sent a General Call but the user programmed the byte following the General Call to be a read from the bus (IC_DATA_CMD[9] is set to 1).

field.name: ABRT_HS_ACKDET
field.description: 1: Master is in High Speed mode and the High Speed Master code was acknowledged (wrong behavior)

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Master is in High Speed mode and the High Speed Master code was acknowledged (wrong behavior).

field.name: ABRT_SBYTE_ACKDET
field.description: 1: Master has sent a START Byte and the START Byte was acknowledged (wrong behavior)

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Master has sent a START Byte and the START Byte was acknowledged (wrong behavior).

field.name: ABRT_HS_NORSTRT
field.description: 1: The restart is disabled (IC_RESTART_EN bit (IC_CON[5]) =0) and the user is trying to use the master to transfer data in High Speed mode

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: The restart is disabled (IC_RESTART_EN bit (IC_CON[5]) =0) and the user is trying to use the master to transfer data in High Speed mode.

field.name: ABRT_SBYTE_NORSTRT
field.description: To clear Bit 9, the source of the ABRT_SBYTE_NORSTRT must be fixed first; restart must be enabled (IC_CON[5]=1), the SPECIAL bit must be cleared (IC_TAR[11]), or the GC_OR_START bit must be cleared (IC_TAR[10])

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: The restart is disabled (IC_RESTART_EN bit (IC_CON[5]) =0) and the user is trying to send a START Byte.

field.name: ABRT_10B_RD_NORSTRT
field.description: 1: The restart is disabled (IC_RESTART_EN bit (IC_CON[5]) =0) and the master sends a read command in 10-bit addressing mode

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: The restart is disabled (IC_RESTART_EN bit (IC_CON[5]) =0) and the master sends a read command in 10-bit addressing mode.

field.name: ABRT_MASTER_DIS
field.description: 1: User tries to initiate a Master operation with the Master mode disabled

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: User tries to initiate a Master operation with the Master mode disabled.

field.name: ARB_LOST
field.description: 1: Master has lost arbitration, or if IC_TX_ABRT_SOURCE[14] is also set, then the slave transmitter has lost arbitration

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Master has lost arbitration, or if IC_TX_ABRT_SOURCE[14] is also set, then the slave transmitter has lost arbitration.

field.name: ABRT_SLVFLUSH_TXFIFO
field.description: 1: Slave has received a read command and some data exists in the TX FIFO so the slave issues a TX_ABRT interrupt to flush old data in TX FIFO

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Slave has received a read command and some data exists in the TX FIFO so the slave issues a TX_ABRT interrupt to flush old data in TX FIFO.

field.name: ABRT_SLV_ARBLOST
field.description: 1: Slave lost the bus while transmitting data to a remote master

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: Slave lost the bus while transmitting data to a remote master. IC_TX_ABRT_SOURCE[12] is set at the same time.

field.name: ABRT_SLVRD_INTX
field.description: 1: When the processor side responds to a slave mode request for data to be transmitted to a remote master and user writes a 1 in CMD (bit 8) of IC_DATA_CMD register

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: When the processor side responds to a slave mode request for data to be transmitted to a remote master and user writes a 1 in CMD (bit 8) of IC_DATA_CMD register.

register.name: IC_SLV_DATA_NACK_ONLY
register.description: Name: Generate Slave Data NACK Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x84 Read/Write Access: Read/Write The register is used to generate a NACK for the data part of a transfer when DW_apb_i2c is acting as a slave-receiver. This register only exists when the IC_SLV_DATA_NACK_ONLY parameter is set to 1. When this parameter disabled, this register does not exist and writing to the register's address has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: V_1
enumeratedValue.description: generate NACK after data byte received

register.name: IC_DMA_CR
register.description: Name: DMA Control Register Size: 2 bits Address Offset: 0x88 Read/Write Access: Read/Write This register is only valid when DW_apb_i2c is configured with a set of DMA Controller interface signals (IC_HAS_DMA = 1). When DW_apb_i2c is not configured for DMA operation, this register does not exist and writing to the register's address has no effect and reading from this register address will return zero. The register is used to enable the DMA Controller interface operation. There is a separate bit for transmit and receive. This can be programmed regardless of the state of IC_ENABLE.

register.name: IC_DMA_TDLR
register.description: Name: DMA Transmit Data Level Register Size: 2 bits Address Offset: 0x8c Read/Write Access: Read/Write This register is only valid when the DW_apb_i2c is configured with a set of DMA interface signals (IC_HAS_DMA = 1). When DW_apb_i2c is not configured for DMA operation, this register does not exist; writing to its address has no effect; reading from its address returns zero.

register.name: IC_DMA_RDLR
register.description: Name: I2C Receive Data Level Register Size: 2 bits Address Offset: 0x90 Read/Write Access: Read/Write This register is only valid when DW_apb_i2c is configured with a set of DMA interface signals (IC_HAS_DMA = 1). When DW_apb_i2c is not configured for DMA operation, this register does not exist; writing to its address has no effect; reading from its address returns zero.

register.name: IC_SDA_SETUP
register.description: Name: I2C SDA Setup Register Size: 8 bits Address Offset: 0x94 Read/Write Access: Read/Write This register controls the amount of time delay (in terms of number of ic_clk clock periods) introduced in the rising edge of SCL, relative to SDA changing, when DW_apb_i2c services a read request in a slave-transmitter operation. The relevant I2C requirement is tSU:DAT (note 4) as detailed in the I2C Bus Specification.

register.name: IC_ACK_GENERAL_CALL
register.description: Name: I2C ACK General Call Register Size: 1 bit Address Offset: 0x98 Read/Write Access: Read/Write The register controls whether DW_apb_i2c responds with a ACK or NACK when it receives an I2C General Call address.

register.name: IC_ENABLE_STATUS
register.description: Name: I2C Enable Status Register Size: 3 bits Address Offset: 0x9C Read/Write Access: Read The register is used to report the DW_apb_i2c hardware status when the IC_ENABLE register is set from 1 to 0; that is, when DW_apb_i2c is disabled. If IC_ENABLE has been set to 1, bits 2:1 are forced to 0, and bit 0 is forced to 1. If IC_ENABLE has been set to 0, bits 2:1 is only be valid as soon as bit 0 is read as '0'. Note When IC_ENABLE has been written with '0'a delay occurs for bit 0 to be read as '0' because disabling the DW_apb_i2c depends on I2C bus activities.

register.name: IC_FS_SPKLEN
register.description: Name: I2C SS and FS spike suppression limit Size: 8 bits Address: 0xA0 Read/Write Access: Read/Write This register is used to store the duration, measured in ic_clk cycles, of the longest spike that is filtered out by the spike suppression logic w hen the component is operating in SS or FS modes. The relevant I2C requirement is tSP (table 4) as detailed in the I2C Bus Specification. This register must be programmed with a minimum value of 2.

field.name: IC_FS_SPKLEN
field.description: This register must be set before any I2C bus transaction can take place to ensure stable operation

register.name: IC_HS_SPKLEN
register.description: Name: I2C HS spike suppression limit Size: 8 bits Address: 0xA4 Read/Write Access: Read/Write This register is used to store the duration, measured in ic_clk cycles, of the longest spike that is filtered out by the spike suppression logic w hen the component is operating in HS modes. The relevant I2C requirement is tSP (table 6) as detailed in the I2C Bus Specification. This register must be programmed with a minimum value of 2.

field.name: IC_HS_SPKLEN
field.description: This register must be set before any I2C bus transaction can take place to ensure stable operation

register.name: IC_COMP_PARAM_1
register.description: Name: Component Parameter Register 1 Size: 32 bits Address Offset: 0xf4 Read/Write Access: Read Note This is a constant read-only register that contains encoded information about the component's parameter settings. The reset value depends on coreConsultant parameter(s).

field.name: APB_DATA_WIDTH
field.description: The value of this register is derived from the APB_DATA_WIDTH coreConsultant parameter

field.name: MAX_SPEED_MODE
field.description: The value of this register is derived from the IC_MAX_SPEED_MODE coreConsultant parameter

field.name: HC_COUNT_VALUES
field.description: The value of this register is derived from the IC_HC_COUNT VALUES coreConsultant parameter 0: False 1: True

field.name: INTR_IO
field.description: The value of this register is derived from the IC_INTR_IO coreConsultant parameter 0: Individual 1: Combined

field.name: HAS_DMA
field.description: The value of this register is derived from the IC_HAS_DMA coreConsultant parameter 0: False 1: True

field.name: ADD_ENCODED_PARAMS
field.description: The value of this register is derived from the IC_ADD_ENCODED_PARAMS coreConsultant parameter

field.name: RX_BUFFER_DEPTH
field.description: The value of this register is derived from the IC_RX_BUFFER_DEPTH coreConsultant parameter

field.name: TX_BUFFER_DEPTH
field.description: The value of this register is derived from the IC_TX_BUFFER_DEPTH coreConsultant parameter

register.name: IC_COMP_VERSION
register.description: Name: I2C Component Version Register Size: 32 bits Address Offset: 0xf8 Read/Write Access: Read

field.name: IC_COMP_VERSION
field.description: Specific values for this register are described in the Releases Table in the DW_apb_i2c Release Notes

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: SSPx port is idle or disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: SSPx port is currently transmitting or receiving framed data.

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: TX FIFO level exceeds the TFT threshold (TFT + 1), or SSPx port disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: TXFIFO level is at or below TFT threshold (TFT + 1), causes an interrupt request.

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: RXFIFO level is at or below RFT threshold (RFT), or SSPx port is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: RXFIFO level exceeds RFT threshold (RFT), causes an interrupt request

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: RXFIFO has not experienced an overrun.

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: Attempted data write to full RXFIFO, causes an interrupt request.

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: The TXFIFO has not experienced an underrun.

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: A read from the TXFIFO was attempted when the TXFIFO was empty, causes an interrupt if it is enabled (<Transmit FIFO Underrun Interrupt Mask> in the SSP Control Register 0 is 0).

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: The SSPx port is ready for slave clock operations.

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: The SSPx port is currently busy synchronizing slave mode signals.

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: The SSPx port has not experienced a bit count error.

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: The SSPSFRMx signal was asserted when the bit counter was not zero.

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: TxFIFO entry has an even number of samples

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: TxFIFO entry has an odd number of sample.

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: Generates a non-maskable TXFIFO-service interrupt request and DMA request

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: Generates a non-maskable RXFIFO-service interrupt request and DMA request

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: Generates a non-maskable RXFIFO-overrun interrupt request. No DMA request is generated

enumeratedValue.name: V0x0

enumeratedValue.name: V0x1

enumeratedValue.name: V0x2

enumeratedValue.name: V0x3

enumeratedValue.name: V1

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-update normal (can be used for any clock relationship between the counter clock and the APB clock; only every 3-4 counter ticks are updated to CNT_VAL)

enumeratedValue.name: V1

enumeratedValue.name: V3

enumeratedValue.name: V1

field.description: ASCII value for each number in the version, followed by *

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the counter (poll CNT_RUN for 1 to confirm that the counter is enabled internally)

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the counter (poll CNT_RUN for 0 to confirm that the counter is disabled internally)

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset the counter (counter is reset to 0; channel output states are reset to 0; poll CNT_RST_DONE for 1 before writing to any other registers)

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates that the counter is still resetting

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates that the counter has been reset

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates that the system reset is still asserted

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates that the system reset is deasserted

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: In debug mode, stop the counters

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: In debug mode, counters are not affected

enumeratedValue.name: V2
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-update (use when counter clock is at least 5 times slower than the register bus clock)

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: reset cause is not system software reset request

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: reset cause is system software reset request

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: reset cause is not watchdog timer

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: do not reset the power system

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: generate an interrupt when VBAT brownout

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: PLL clock not ready for use

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: RC 32M clock not ready for use

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: XTAL 32k clock not ready for use

enumeratedValue.name: V0
enumeratedValue.description: PLL audio clock not ready for use

enumeratedValue.name: V1
enumeratedValue.description: PLL audio clock ready for use
